definitions: a discussion between enemies or opposing sides, especially to agree terms for stopping fighting
examples: The generals called for a parley to discuss surrender terms
After hours of parley, both sides reached a ceasefire agreement

definitions: a member of a parliament, especially one well-versed in its procedures
an expert in parliamentary procedure and rules of formal meetings
examples: The parliamentarian served her district for over twenty years
Several parliamentarians spoke against the proposed legislation
We consulted the parliamentarian about the proper voting procedure
The organization hired a parliamentarian to ensure meetings ran smoothly

definitions: a room in a house for receiving and entertaining guests
a shop or business providing specified goods or services
examples: Grandmother's parlor was filled with antique furniture and family photos
We gathered in the parlor after dinner for conversation
She opened a beauty parlor on Main Street last year
The ice cream parlor serves homemade flavors every summer

definitions: a room in a house for receiving and entertaining guests
a shop or business providing specified goods or services
examples: The Victorian parlour featured heavy curtains and ornate wallpaper
Tea was served in the parlour every afternoon
The funeral parlour handled all the arrangements with dignity
She visited the tattoo parlour to get her first design

definitions: a humorous or satirical imitation of a serious work, style, or person
examples: The comedy show featured a brilliant parody of the presidential debate
His parody of Shakespeare made the whole audience laugh

definitions: the release of a prisoner before the end of their sentence on condition of good behavior
the status of a prisoner who has been conditionally released from incarceration
examples: He was granted parole after serving five years of his sentence
The parole board meets monthly to review eligible cases
She remained on parole for two years following her release
Violating parole conditions could result in returning to prison

definitions: a floor covering made of wooden blocks arranged in a geometric pattern
examples: The ballroom's parquet floor gleamed under the chandelier lights
They restored the original parquet flooring in the historic mansion

definitions: a tropical bird with bright feathers and a hooked beak, often kept as a pet
a person who repeats words or ideas without understanding them
examples: The green parrot learned to say over fifty different phrases
Wild parrots filled the rainforest with their loud calls
Don't be a parrot who just repeats what others say
He was merely a parrot of his professor's theories

definitions: a defensive movement in fencing or fighting to ward off a blow or thrust
examples: The fencer's quick parry deflected her opponent's attack
He learned to parry and thrust in his swordsmanship class

definitions: a computer program that analyzes text or code according to formal grammar rules
examples: The parser identified syntax errors in the programming code
We need a better parser to process these complex data files

definitions: extreme unwillingness to spend money or use resources; excessive economy or stinginess
examples: His parsimony meant the research project lacked essential equipment
The company's parsimony with employee benefits hurt staff morale

definitions: a garden herb with curly or flat leaves used for seasoning and garnishing food
examples: She sprinkled fresh parsley over the pasta before serving
The recipe calls for two tablespoons of chopped parsley

definitions: a member of the clergy, especially a Protestant minister in charge of a parish
examples: The parson delivered a moving sermon about forgiveness
Our village parson has served the community for thirty years

definitions: a house provided by a church for its minister or pastor to live in
examples: The old parsonage stood next to the village church
They renovated the parsonage before the new minister arrived

definitions: unfair bias in favor of one person or thing over another; lack of impartiality
examples: The judge's partiality toward the defendant raised concerns about fairness
Her partiality for chocolate desserts was well known

definitions: a word formed from a verb that can function as an adjective or part of a verb tense
examples: In 'the running water,' running is a present participle
Past participles like 'broken' can describe nouns or form perfect tenses

definitions: the quality of being individual or particular; attention to detail
a distinctive or unique feature or characteristic of something
examples: She described the scene with great particularity
The lawyer insisted on particularity in drafting the contract
Each region has its own particularities of dialect and custom
The particularity of his writing style made him instantly recognizable

definitions: a minute particle of solid or liquid matter suspended in air or another medium
examples: The air filter removes particulate matter from the ventilation system
High particulate levels in cities contribute to respiratory problems

definitions: the action of leaving or being separated from someone
a line where hair is combed in different directions
examples: Their emotional parting at the airport brought tears to everyone
The parting of ways was inevitable after years of disagreement
She changed her hair parting from center to side
His neat parting gave him a professional appearance

definitions: a strong supporter of a party, cause, or person, often showing bias
a member of an armed resistance group fighting against occupying forces
examples: The partisan crowd cheered wildly for their political candidate
His partisan views prevented him from seeing both sides
The partisans hid in the mountains during the occupation
World War II partisans disrupted enemy supply lines

definitions: strong support for a particular party or cause, often preventing fair consideration of other views
examples: Extreme partisanship has made political compromise nearly impossible
The newspaper was criticized for its obvious partisanship

definitions: a structure that divides a room or space into separate areas
the action of dividing something into parts or the state of being divided
examples: They installed a partition to create two offices from one
The glass partition allowed light while providing privacy
The partition of India in 1947 created two nations
After the partition of assets, each heir received their share

definitions: the act or process of dividing something into separate parts or sections
examples: The partitioning of the hard drive created multiple storage areas
Office partitioning helped create a more organized workspace

definitions: a strong supporter of a party, cause, or person, often showing bias
a member of an armed resistance group fighting against occupying forces
examples: The partizan refused to consider opposing viewpoints
His partizan loyalty to the team never wavered
Yugoslav partizans fought against Nazi occupation
The partizan movement gained strength in the mountains

definitions: a plump game bird with brown plumage, often hunted for sport and food
examples: The hunter spotted a partridge hiding in the undergrowth
Roasted partridge was served at the harvest feast

definitions: a unit of pressure equal to one newton per square meter
a computer programming language designed for teaching programming concepts
examples: The tire pressure was measured at 200,000 pascals
Weather maps show atmospheric pressure in pascals
Students learned Pascal before moving to more complex languages
The Pascal compiler detected several syntax errors

definitions: a corridor or path that allows movement between different areas or rooms
examples: The narrow passageway connected the kitchen to the dining room
Secret passageways were discovered during the castle renovation

definitions: a person who passes by or through a place; one who throws or passes something
examples: The passer stopped to help the injured cyclist
He's the team's best passer with excellent field vision

definitions: a person who happens to be walking past something or someone
examples: A helpful passerby called an ambulance for the accident victim
Several passersby stopped to watch the street performer

definitions: a form of verb or construction where the subject receives the action
examples: In the passive voice, 'The ball was thrown' focuses on the ball
Teachers explained when to use active versus passive constructions

definitions: the state of accepting or allowing what happens without active response or resistance
examples: His passivity in the face of injustice disappointed his friends
The student's passivity in class concerned the teacher

definitions: an official document issued by a government certifying identity and citizenship for international travel
examples: She renewed her passport before the overseas vacation
The immigration officer carefully examined each passport

definitions: a secret word or phrase that must be used to gain admission or access to something
examples: Please create a strong password with letters and numbers
She forgot her password and couldn't access her email account

definitions: food made from flour, water, and sometimes eggs, formed into various shapes and cooked
examples: She cooked pasta with tomato sauce for dinner
The restaurant offers twelve different types of fresh pasta

definitions: a thick, soft, sticky substance used for sticking things together
a thick mixture of ground or crushed ingredients
examples: The children used paste to attach pictures to their art projects
Apply paste evenly to both surfaces before joining
She made a paste of garlic and ginger for the curry
The recipe requires tomato paste for extra flavor

definitions: a crayon made of powdered pigments bound with gum or resin
a soft, pale shade of a color
examples: The artist created beautiful portraits using pastels
Oil pastels produce more vibrant colors than chalk pastels
She decorated the nursery in pastel pink and blue
Pastel colors dominated this season's fashion collections

definitions: the process of heating liquids to destroy harmful microorganisms without major chemical alteration
examples: Pasteurization makes milk safer to drink by killing bacteria
The juice underwent pasteurization before being bottled

definitions: an artistic work that imitates the style of previous works or combines elements from various sources
examples: The novel was a clever pastiche of Victorian detective fiction
His paintings are a pastiche of impressionist techniques

definitions: an activity done regularly for enjoyment rather than work; a hobby
examples: Reading mystery novels was her favorite pastime
Fishing has been a popular pastime for generations

definitions: a work of art portraying rural life in an idealized way
a letter from a bishop to the clergy or members of their diocese
examples: The painting was a pastoral depicting shepherds in green meadows
Beethoven's Sixth Symphony is known as the Pastoral
The bishop issued a pastoral addressing social justice concerns
Churches read the pastoral letter during Sunday services

definitions: the position, term of office, or residence of a pastor or minister
examples: His twenty-year pastorate transformed the struggling congregation
She accepted a pastorate at a church in the suburbs

definitions: dough made from flour, fat, and water used as a base or covering for baked dishes
examples: The baker rolled out pastry for the apple pie
Flaky pastry makes the best croissants and turnovers

definitions: land covered with grass suitable for grazing animals; the right to graze animals
examples: The ranch included five hundred acres of prime pasturage
Farmers pay fees for pasturage rights on public lands

definitions: land covered with grass or other plants suitable for grazing animals
examples: The cows grazed peacefully in the green pasture
They moved the sheep to fresh pasture every few weeks

definitions: land that is used or suitable for the grazing of livestock
examples: The farm consisted of cropland and extensive pastureland
Drought severely reduced the quality of available pastureland

definitions: a folded pastry case with savory filling, typically associated with Cornwall, England
examples: The miners carried pasties for lunch in the coal mines
She bought a traditional Cornish pasty from the bakery

definitions: a light touch or stroke with the hand, typically expressing affection or approval
examples: She gave the dog a pat on the head
His pat on my shoulder was meant to be encouraging

definitions: the process of repairing something by covering holes or worn areas with new material
examples: The road crew spent all day patching potholes
Software patching helps protect computers from security vulnerabilities

definitions: needlework consisting of pieces of cloth sewn together in a pattern
something made up of various different elements forming a whole
examples: Grandmother's patchwork quilt used fabric from old family clothes
The patchwork bedspread displayed intricate geometric patterns
The nation's healthcare system is a patchwork of public and private programs
Their solution was a patchwork of temporary fixes
